TopicTitle: Clean install of KSP from steam and get the mono.dll error

Articles.Content:
Error Logs: https://www.dropbox.com/s/r087kud54szdmrw/KSP Errors.zip?dl=0

System stats: https://www.dropbox.com/s/eq1qhfl8tmtywlc/GAMEDESKTOP.txt?dl=0

So I was bored at work and started watching KSP videos again, and wanted to play. Got home, installed from steam and launched and failed on the loading screen at "Loading Part Upgrades". Reinstalled and tried it again with no luck, so I figured I'd try it harder and used ckan to pop on some mods and got the exact same error message.

Any assistance would be grand, even more so if I could use the knowledge of this error to make it work from my steam USB on the POS 32-bit work pc.

 

Cheers Namod

Wait so is it with or without mods? You say it's a clean install but then you mention ckan and mods.

Either way, a mono.dll error is from outdated mods.

It was from a clean install. Then for giggles I added mods and got the exact same error.

 

Edit:

Did not change anything related to KSP, just altered my page file allocation from system managed to a set value...and viola it works.

Guess it wasn't mods.

 

Edited September 1, 2017 by namod

Every single one of those crash dumps you've provided show a modified install. It may well be that a mod is not playing ball and needs to be updated or matched to the version of KSP you're running.

Try removing the game from your steamapps directory (move it to some other location if you like), and redownload a completely stock copy of the game. If it's still crashing, send us the logs so they can be analysed.

HTH
